item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 3, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The power of interning: making a time series database smaller (132 points | 28 comments)
2. Hacking the Xbox 360 Hypervisor Part 2: The Bad Update Exploit (40 points | 1 comment)
3. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (March 2025) (140 points | 117 comments)
4. SQLite-on-the-Server Is Misunderstood: Better at Hyper-Scale Than Micro-Scale (51 points | 24 comments)
5. Launch HN: Cuckoo (YC W25) – Real-time AI translator for global teams (12 points | 1 comment)
6. Show HN: Knowledge graph of restaurants and chefs, built using LLMs (95 points | 29 comments)
7. Effect of chewing hard material on enhancing cognitive function (24 points | 32 comments)
8. An Attempt to Catch Up with JIT Compilers (54 points | 50 comments)
9. First flat telescope lens that captures color, detecting light from stars (50 points | 7 comments)
10. Keeling Labs (YC W23) Is Hiring an ML Engineer for Climate Tech (Los Angeles) ( | hide)
11. The Golden Age of Japanese Pencils, 1952-1967 (51 points | 10 comments)
12. Show HN: Sonauto API – Generative music for developers (37 points | 21 comments)
13. Go-attention: A full attention mechanism and transformer in pure Go (36 points | 8 comments)

17. Firefly ‘Blue Ghost’ lunar lander touches down on the moon (719 points | 180 comments)
18. Show HN: Open-Source Windows AI assistant that uses Word, Excel through COM (27 points | 2 comments)
19. Ex-SAP CTO walks away with €7.1M payout after scandal (48 points | 13 comments)
20. I'm starting to suspect my work is incompatible with a full-time academic job (14 points | 3 comments)
21. MIT 6.S184: Introduction to Flow Matching and Diffusion Models (294 points | 17 comments)
22. Made a scroll bar buddy that walks down the page when you scroll (564 points | 180 comments)
23. FlakeUI (87 points | 24 comments)
24. Bocoup Is Now Worker-Owned (37 points | 13 comments)
25. Ask HN: How much employee resume verification is done in practice? (28 points | 37 comments)
26. Evals are not all you need (4 points | discuss)
27. AgenticMemory: Zettelkasten inspired agentic memory system (4 points | discuss)
28. Cautious Optimizers: Improving Training with One Line of Code (6 points | discuss)
29. Number-Colour-Phoneme Associations: From IBM CGA Colours to Mnemonic Systems (22 points | 3 comments)
